entities.name: seamus finnigan
entities.description: Seamus Finnigan is a student in Professor Trelawney's class. He is tilting his head from side to side, trying to see if Harry is going to die or not.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is the main character in the story. Professor Trelawney says that he might be dying, which causes everyone to avoid looking at him.

entities.name: professor trelawney
entities.description: Professor Trelawney is the teacher in the story. She has a misty voice and seems to be able to see into the future.

entities.name: neville
entities.description: Neville is another student in Professor Trelawney's class. He is being scolded by Professor Trelawney for being late next time.

entities.name: ron
entities.description: Ron is a friend of Harry's and also a student in Professor Trelawney's class. He is avoiding looking at Harry because he thinks Harry might be dying.

relationships.description: Professor Trelawney says that she perceives very little aura around Harry, implying that she can see into the future and knows something about Harry's fate.
Professor Trelawney scolds Neville for being late next time, showing that she is in charge and has authority over the students.
Ron avoids looking at Harry because he thinks Harry might be dying, showing that Ron is trying to avoid getting involved in whatever is happening with Harry.
